name: Siborong-Borong Sigararutang
desc: Known for its strong body, balanced acidity, and distinctive herbal and spicy notes.
detailed_desc: Sigararutang, meaning 'the debt payer' in Batak language due to its high productivity, is sourced from North Tapanuli Regency and surrounding highland areas. This variety is renowned for its strong body, balanced acidity, and distinctive herbal and spicy notes. First commercial harvest occurs around 3.5-4.5 years after planting, with optimal quality produced at 1,000-1,400 masl.

name: Sidikalang Arabica
desc: Complex flavor profile with floral and fruity aromas, balanced acidity, and clean aftertaste.
detailed_desc: Sourced from Sidikalang District in the Bukit Barisan mountain range, this coffee has a rich history dating back to the Dutch colonial era. Sidikalang Arabica offers a complex flavor profile with floral and fruity aromas, balanced acidity, and a remarkably clean aftertaste that distinguishes it from other Sumatran coffees.

name: Sidikalang Robusta
desc: Full body, earthy and herbal notes, and strong character. GI Certified.
detailed_desc: This premium Robusta from Sidikalang features a full body with earthy and herbal notes, delivering a strong, bold character. It has received the prestigious Geographical Indication (GI) certification, recognizing its unique quality tied to the terroir of Dairi Regency.

name: Mandailing Arabica
desc: Full body, low acidity, with herbal, floral, and earthy aroma.
detailed_desc: From the Mandailing Natal region in the Bukit Barisan mountain range, this coffee was first introduced around 1835 during the Dutch colonial era. Mandailing Arabica is celebrated for its full body, low acidity, and complex herbal, floral, and earthy aromas that have made it famous worldwide.

name: Gayo Highland Arabica
desc: Clean cup profile, rich body, and balanced acidity. GI Certified.
detailed_desc: From the Gayo Highlands of Aceh Tengah, Bener Meriah, and Gayo Lues, this internationally recognized specialty coffee boasts a clean cup profile, rich body, and balanced acidity. With Geographical Indication (GI) status, Gayo coffee is exported to USA, Europe, and Japan, representing the finest of Indonesian specialty coffee.

name: Gayo Robusta
desc: Strong body, bold bitterness, and chocolatey undertones with earthy notes.
detailed_desc: Gayo Robusta delivers a powerful cup with a strong body, bold bitterness, and distinctive chocolatey undertones. Grown in the highlands of Aceh, this coffee is perfect for espresso blends or for those seeking an intense, full-flavored coffee experience with the unique character of Gayo terroir.
